reviews.title: Wild on La Casona
reviews.text: We stayed for four days at La Casona in May of 2004, and we could not have had a better experience. The staff is extremely helpful and mostly English speaking, the beds are comfortable and rooms cleverly appointed. It is a little bit more off the beaten path and you will have to walk a little or take cabs if you want to get anywhere, but it is not terribly far from the subway, and that can help hasten the journey. If you want to stay somewhere that isn't a chain, La Casona is the place to stay in Mexico City.

reviews.title: Fabulous & Charming Hotel
reviews.text: Note: my fiancee did get ill eating the cheese on the last day in the breakfast buffet. We don't think it is the kitchen's fault nearly as much as it is the gastrnomic adventure of eating in a country that uses (potentially) unpasturized milk in their food.
La Casona is a very quiet and charming boutique hotel.

Oh La La Casona!
reviews.text: Ideally located, it only took us 20 minutes to reach the nearby exciting 'Zona Rosa'.
